verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Direct introduction formula, as in the original Hebrew.

verses.text: Command the people of Israel to bring you pure oil from beaten olives for the light, to keep a lamp burning continually.
verses.comment: 'Beaten' oil refers to oil extracted by crushing, considered the purest.

verses.text: Outside the veil of the testimony, in the Tent of Meeting, Aaron shall tend it from evening to morning before the LORD continually. It shall be a lasting statute throughout your generations.
verses.comment: The lamp is placed outside the curtain separating the Holy of Holies.

verses.text: He shall arrange the lamps on the pure gold lampstand before the LORD continually.
verses.comment: Refers to the menorah, the gold lampstand.

verses.text: You shall take fine flour and bake twelve loaves from it; two tenths of an ephah shall be in each loaf.
verses.comment: Twelve loaves match the twelve tribes; ephah is a dry measure (~22 liters).

verses.text: You shall set them in two rows, six in a row, on the pure gold table before the LORD.
verses.comment: Bread arranged in two rows on the showbread table.

verses.text: You shall put pure frankincense on each row, as a memorial portion for the bread, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
verses.comment: Incense symbolizes a memorial offering accompanying the bread.

verses.text: Every Sabbath day Aaron shall arrange it before the LORD continually; it is from the people of Israel as an everlasting covenant.
verses.comment: Bread of the Presence replaced each Sabbath.

verses.text: And it shall be for Aaron and his sons, and they shall eat it in a holy place, for it is a most holy part for him from the LORD’s food offerings, a perpetual statute.
verses.comment: Priests eat the consecrated bread as their portion.

verses.text: Now the son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the people of Israel. And the Israelite woman’s son and a man of Israel fought in the camp,
verses.comment: Contrast between Israelite mother and Egyptian father is kept.

verses.text: and the Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the Name, and cursed. Then they brought him to Moses. (His mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.)
verses.comment: 'Blasphemed the Name' refers to speaking the divine name irreverently.

verses.text: And they put him in custody, until the will of the LORD should be made clear to them.
verses.comment: Retains idiom 'the will of the LORD' for clarity.

verses.text: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Standard prophetic introduction.

verses.text: Bring out the one who cursed, outside the camp, and let all those who heard him lay their hands on his head, and let all the congregation stone him.
verses.comment: Hands on head transfers responsibility for witness.

verses.text: And you shall speak to the people of Israel, saying, 'Whoever curses his God shall bear his sin.
verses.comment: 'Bear his sin' means take responsibility for the guilt.

verses.text: Whoever blasphemes the name of the LORD shall surely be put to death; all the congregation shall certainly stone him. The sojourner as well as the native, when he blasphemes the Name, shall be put to death.'
verses.comment: Equality before the law: native and sojourner alike.

verses.text: Whoever takes the life of any human shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Literal: 'strikes down any person.' Refers to murder.

verses.text: Whoever kills an animal shall make it good: life for life.
verses.comment: 'Make it good' means to pay compensation.

verses.text: If anyone injures his neighbor, as he has done, it shall be done to him:
verses.comment: Law of retaliation ('lex talionis').

verses.text: Fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; just as he has injured another person, so it shall be done to him.
verses.comment: Literal rendering; physical retaliation as the law prescribed.

verses.text: Whoever kills an animal shall make it good, and whoever kills a person shall be put to death.
verses.comment: Repeats principle of animal compensation and capital punishment for murder.

verses.text: You shall have the same law for the sojourner and for the native, for I am the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Divine rationale for equal application of law.

verses.text: So Moses spoke to the people of Israel, and they brought the one who had cursed out of the camp and stoned him with stones. So the people of Israel did as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Concludes the narrative by reporting obedience to God's command.
